Intervention: Combination of daily exemestane 25 mg with a monthly injection of Fulvestant 250 mg
Fluvestant: 250 mg of IM from day 8 and every 28 days.
Eligibility: Metastatic or locally advanced breast cancer
A hormone response disease defined as positive for estrogen (ER) and/ or progesterone (PR) receptors (> 10% immunohistochemistry staining)
No more than one prior chemotherapy for stage IV metastatic breast cancer authorised
ECOG (Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group) Statement of Operations 0-2
An uncontrolled intercurrent disease, including, but not limited to:
Myocardial infarction in the last 3 months
Psychiatric diseases/social situations that would limit compliance with the study
• Lymphangitis pulmonary disease; carcinoma meningitis, bone marrow metastases only; and a tumor marker growing without any other metastatic disease site.
Presence of haemorrhagic diathesis or coagulopathy, patients requiring coumadine
Results: Time of progression (TTP) in women with advanced hormonal receptive breast cancer treated with exemestane and fulvestrant.

The progression is defined using the criteria for assessing response in solid tumours (RECIST v1.0), such as a 20% increase in the sum of the longest diameter of the target lesions, or a measurable increase in non-target injury, or the occurrence of new lesions.
Calendar: Every 2 cycles up to 2 years
Title of the arm/group: Exemestane and Fulvestant
Description of the arm/group: Combination of daily exemestane 25 mg with a monthly injection of Fulvestant 250 mg
Fluvestant: 250 mg of IM from day 8 and every 28 days.
